subject: Re: [junit] Classspath for ClassLoader
msgSnippet: on 12/20/00 8:28 AM, G Ramasubramani at grama@aztec.soft.net wrote: Ben, Thanks a lot for the information. If I configure the TestRunner to be non-loading then
messageBody:
Re: [junit] Classspath for ClassLoader on 12/20/00 8:28 AM, G Ramasubramani at grama@... wrote:

Ben,

       Thanks a lot for the information. If I configure the TestRunner to be non-loading then the test succeeds without displaying any of the problems as earlier.

       As I understand it, we use loading only so that we can change the test classes without having to bring down the junit process each time we do the change. If thats the only effect, I can live without it :-)

Glad to hear that it worked.  I'll let you know if I remember what was going on when I saw the problem -- the loading behavior is really nice.

---
Ben Schroeder
schroeder@...
